intro: Dryas babingtoniana, commonly known as the alpine avens, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Rosaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure with silver-gray foliage. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers in early spring, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. Dryas babingtoniana is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in challenging garden conditions.
